result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Patrick Byrd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: 1 year probation - conditions of probation court costs/surcharges totaling $543.00; take medication as prescribed by doctor; 3 days sentence credit.

miscConds.notes: $543.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
take medication as prescribed by doctor;

judgments.dispoDesc: Sentence Withheld - 3 days credit for time served.  Sentence 1 year probation - conditions of probation court costs/surcharges totaling $543.00; take medication as prescribed by doctor; 3 days sentence credit.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Sentenced to 53 days county jail with good time and 40 days credit time served.
costs as previously ordered are converted to a civil judgment

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Patrick Byrd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Patrick Byrd in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Charles Patrick Byrd in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:35 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Both parties rec'd revocation packet.    State jt. resolution jail 40 days credit time served requests 53 days jail and civil judgment to outstanding fines.  Atty Gramstrup agrees.  DE addressed the Court.  State makes stmt he has 2 add'l cases Atty Poquette is handling.  Atty Gramstrup makes stmt does have misd. DC charges and makes further stmt.  Atty Marcoux makes stmt as to pending cases there is a cash bond.

Court:  Sentenced to 53 days county jail with credit for 40 days time served and good time - costs are converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-17-2015 02:30 pm
38 hours in lieu of DOC fine
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Charles Patrick Byrd in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights; joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; victim notification completed.  Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1; Victim addresses the court.  Sentence Withheld - 3 days credit for time served.  Sentence 1 year probation - conditions of probation court costs/surcharges totaling $543.00; take medication as prescribed by doctor; advised of appeal rights; plea questionnaire filed; report to probation and parole today.

Court modifies Bond required to take medications according to physician 
  No abusive Contact with  - Mother Sheree Byrd
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Court modifies Bond required to take medications according to physcian.

Mentor Parker Taylor advised the court with request to have bond modified with release of No contact of mother Sheree Byrd,  State objects,  Court modifies Bond to have NO abusive contact with Mother Sheree Byrd and required to take medications according to physcian.
